conversation.speaker: USER
conversation.text: I'm in the mood for a prison movie. Could you recommend a few?

conversation.speaker: SYSTEM
conversation.text:
I think I have just the thing for you! Have you considered "The Condemned"? It's a thrilling and intense prison movie where a group of condemned killers are forced to fight each other to the death on a deserted island. With Nathan Jones and Sullivan Stapleton leading the cast, it's an action-packed ride from start to finish.

Alternatively, if you're in the mood for something a bit more...out of this world, "Alien 3" might be up your alley! This sci-fi horror classic brings back Sigourney Weaver as Ellen Ripley, who crash-lands on a maximum-security prison planet and must fight against an even more terrifying threat: a deadly alien creature.

conversation.speaker: USER

conversation.text: I think I've got just the right fit for you! If you liked the sound of Alien 3, I think you might enjoy The Green Mile. It's a thought-provoking and emotionally charged film with a strong focus on character development, much like Alien 3. Plus, Tom Hanks is in it, so you know it's going to be good!

The film's twisty plot and suspenseful atmosphere make it an excellent choice for your new preferences!

If you're looking for something a bit more contemporary, I'd recommend "The Wrestler". This critically-acclaimed film tells the story of a professional wrestler struggling to come to terms with his own mortality, and features a powerful performance from Mickey Rourke.

If that doesn't catch your eye, I also think "Monsters, Inc." could be a great choice. It's a fun, lighthearted animated film with a clever premise about monsters who scare children for energy. John Goodman and Billy Crystal are just two of the many talented voice actors you'll hear in this one!
